content.description:
Extremely difficult climbing (for the grade) to the first bolt (which is relatively high at approx 3+ metres off the ground) consisting of thin slab climbing on very small holds with little hands. This continues to the second bolt, after which the climb eases significantly on larger holds and lower angle rock. Consider stick-clipping the first bolt or risking a ground fall. Not recommended for a newer leader not confident at considerably higher grades (first two bolts seem very sandbagged for 5.6)



The bolt line immediately in front of the climber approaching Solstice wall from the trail. Left most bolted line on the wall.

6 bolts to a bolted anchor
Secluded crag up in the trees overlooking first rock (on the other side of the creek)
